title: BC Nursery, Pre-Prep & Prep
subtitle:
Celebrating #WorldChildrensDay 

Our Prep pupils are celebrating #WorldChildrensDay today by participating in the 'World's Largest Lesson'. Discussions have been taking place this morning surrounding the definitions of refugees and asylum seekers. pic.twitter.com/FDmZRtzoh1

title: St George's Primary
subtitle: What could you do? We have seen children make a difference and use their voices to effect positive change.  Eryn Zander helped us to understand how people become refugees and what  we can do to support refugees in our country. #sportunitypic.twitter.com/keYlLdzlxR

title: IRT
subtitle: IRT are very proud and excited to be part of The Big Give's Christmas Challenge this year! This means your donation's between 3rd - 10th December, will be DOUBLED! title: JackW
subtitle: Amy, why not judge him on what he himself has done? I was at the event and it was actually so worth listening to. Here is a former Syrian refugees take on it (talking about the equivalent protests yesterday at KCL) pic.twitter.com/xvTk6Nmbwx

title: Emma Flynn
subtitle: This morning in Whole Class Reading, we read the poem ‘Refugees’ by Brian Bilston. About 20 minutes into the lesson, we read it from the bottom and Year 6 were amazed. The impact of words is incredible. We concluded that how we view the world depends on our perspective @GarstonCEpic.twitter.com/F7TXlBEMg4

title: SilentBun Gaming
subtitle:
Easy 100% of the Day #1

Title: North

Platform: PS4+Vita

Very short First Person Adventure game putting you in the shoes of a refugee attempting to apply for asylum in a surreal world full of strange creatures and customs.

The whole 100% can be done in under 30 mins. pic.twitter.com/0JJYWLp1hF

title: NACCOM
subtitle: In the past year, members across the NACCOM network have offered an estimated total of 410,323 nights of accommodation to people seeking asylum and refugees experiencing destitution. Without this vital lifeline, many would end up homeless. #EndDestitution http://ow.ly/c6ge50xdDbO pic.twitter.com/uQF4M7vWPp

title: Penygarn School
subtitle: Our Y5 and 6 Eco Committee members took part in an Eco Day with other schools last week, to learn about migration. We learnt lots about refugees and animal migration and had lots of fun. pic.twitter.com/5vTKg8GW1q

title: JRS International
subtitle: Sr Rebecca Abiyo, MSMMC, Headmistress of St Mary Assumpta Secondary School, shares her experience of working with JRS in Uganda to ensure access to education to South Sudanese refugees. #FaithInActionpic.twitter.com/ddZTMXIMgB

title: Emma Knight
subtitle: Took my youth group tonight to pack boxes of clothes to send over to Greece for refugees. They packed a record of 50 boxes in an hour (I’m good at organising child labour). The camp is made for 3,000 military but currently has 17,000 refugees. pic.twitter.com/DWTk7MBDDS
